Looks like I'm gonna have to find them.
Those guys are having a hard time.
Yeah,\. where else do you think university janitors live?
I don't know...\. Like,\. anywhere but the university?
Haha,\. why go through the mess everyday when you can live in it?
How do you know where to go?
How do you know where to go?
How do you navigate this place?\.\. How does it feel to live in a maze?
Isolated\..\..\.. and lost.\.\. Honestly, for the first few years I used bread crumbs.\.\. Kinda like "Hansel and Gretel", ya know?
I vividly remember this one time when I was leaving behind crumbs and little Woofie here ate the crumbs as I dropped them.\| Took me a month to get back to this room.
Man,\. that's some Bear Grylls level survival right there.
Haha\., yeah.\.\. He's a chill dude,\. we shared some experiences over a pint of some Mypiss Lager.
Yeah,\. I met him as he was filming an episode of "Man vs. Maze" here,\. in this building.\.\. I even brought the camera crew some hot chocolate.\.\. Nice people,\. really.
That's\..\..\.. actually pretty awesome.\.\. By the way,\. did your dog bring back any papers yesterday?
Nope,\. I took him for a stroll yesterday and it's the only time he's been outside.
Damn.\.\. A dog that looks just like Woofie grabbed my homework yesterday before I submitted it.
Well,\. that's quite a dilemma isn't it.\.\. Hmm,\. I believe that Quebrith Hanover has a dog of the same breed as Woofie.
Professor Hanover,\. he teaches modern philosophy here.
\{OH!\}\| I'm in his course this semester!
Well,\. I hope you find your homework.
Me too.\.\. Thanks for the lead!
So,\. here's the thing.\.\. I'm a massive Bear Grylls fan.\.\. Is there any way you can get me in touch with him?
I wish.\.\. He left for the South American rainforests and hasn't come back.\.\. Something about settling with the sloths?\.\. He's a weird dude.
Aw man,\. I had my hopes up.
Haha,\. I think Professor Hanover might be able to help you with that \.-\.\. you know,\. modern philosophy and all that jazz.\.\.
Hum, you know,\. he has a dog just like Woofie.\.\. I remember confusing his dog for Woofie once,\. Woofie was mad at me for days\. ha\.ha.
R\.i\.ight.\.\. I'm gonna go find Professor Hanover.\.\. Thanks for the lead Janitor Man.
\fiSigh\fi\.\. Kids these days,\. can't even ask for a title.
Posh place you got here.\.\. It's a fascinating contrast in comparison to the rest of this building.
If I was going to be here for a while,\. I might as well live it up in style,\. eh?
Fair.\.\. Definitely was not expecting something of this,\. uh,\. scale?
Never expected a janitor to be living it up?
Haha,\. no worries.\.\. Yeah,\. it's a deal that has its pros and cons.
Mhm,\. I get to live in this awesome place,\. but the location isn't the best,\. to put it lightly.
Seriously?\.\. I think it's worth the location.\.\. I mean,\. look at all this space.\.\. Sounds like a pretty sweet deal to me.
I see where you're coming from!\.\. I used to think the same way too,\. to be honest.\.\. But over time the cost of luxury might not have been the best thing to pay.
That's deep.\.\. Maybe you're right,\. it does feel quite lonely.
I studied under Professor Hanover for my graduate degree,\. I've read some deep stuff.

Professor Hanover?\.\.
He teaches Philosophy 342 as well,\. right?
That's the one.\. He has a dog just like Woofie too.\.\. I like to think we get along pretty well.

Nope,\. we only went out yesterday for a walk.\.\. That's pretty much the only time he's been outside.
I see...\.\. Well,\. thanks for your time,\. sir.\|
Could you show me the way out of here?

Those guys are having a hard time.
Yeah,\. you might want to.\. Those guys seemed quite shaken up.
It's always the same problem too.\. I order a bunch of stuff,\. I wait a week and then if I still get no knock,\. I set out to find the lost deliverymen.
That's a lot of packages for a week.
Just some basic stuff.\. You know,\. veggies and carbs.\.\. It's easier to order groceries online, believe it or not.
Sure,\. but what about the guarantee for quality and other stuff?
I've never gotten bad quality products so far,\. actually.\. I think they have guarantees in place too.

Yeah,\. it sounds strange to say because we've always associated groceries with marts and such.\.\. I do suggest experiencing it for yourself.\.\. It's time efficient and the products are as fresh as they come!
What about the time away from home?
What about the time away from home?
What about the time away from home?
